reviewText: One of the reasons I do Leslie Sansone's workouts is that I have problems with one of my knees, and her workouts are typically very low impact - even those that are quite rigorous in terms of pace, the addition of weights and even those that require "sitting down" into a squat are fine.  In this session, she does a lot of actual hopping, jumping, twisting while hopping (a big no-no for me) and quite a bit of jogging, which is fine for some, but not this girl.  For that reason, I think calling this a "walk" DVD is a misnomer, and the title should be corrected.  I'll continue to workout to her other routines, but this one isn't for me.
summary: There are many other Sansone workouts that I prefer
Title: N/A

reviewText: I love all of Leslie's DVD's and I have been using most of them for the last 2 years. This one is the most challenging of all because it is intervals of slow walking and then "surges". This DVD is certainly the bounciest. With a sore knee, I did not do the mini jumping jacks; I simply jogged in place and still got a good, sweaty workout. The editing is not as perfect as her other videos. When the camera shot changes, she is using a different foot. She says that is not a problem, but it is easier to follow when using the same foot. I would recommend this DVD to anyone, even beginners, because her workouts are non-threatening and good for all age groups.
summary: Get a good sports bra for this one, ladies!
Title: N/A

reviewText: If you are familiar with Leslie Sansone, you know her fitness empire is built on walking moves and simple modifications of four or so basic movements.  This is no exception,but there is a bit of higher impact thrown in to the "power miles".  I am a pretty fit baby boomer who has been exercising for over 30 years and have taught fitness classes myself.  So based on that experience and knowledge I highly recommend this video for its soundness, safety, and effectiveness.  If you don't want simple moves or a chatty instructor, then Leslie is not for you.  If you want supportive, friendly and not "hardcore in your face bootcamp" on some days, this low key workout will satisfy.  Even though I consider myself to be very fit, I enjoy this workout about one a week.  To make it challenging enough I hold small weights while doing the 4 miles.  The power miles are true intervals (very sound practice) and you can raise your heart rate effectively and then lower it quickly during the "resting" periods.  If you are not so fit, or must avoid impact exercises, you can do the regular miles, omitting the power miles completely.  I have probably 4 or 5 Leslie Sansone videos and this is my personal favorite.  The reason I bought this one from Amazon is that my copy before just wore out--scratched and unplayable!  I guess that means I really liked it.  Now I have my new copy and all is right with my exercise world.  The price at Amazon was better than the leading exercise video catalog or local big box retailers.  I highly recommend this video to any home exerciser of any fitness level with appropriate, common sense modifications as indicated.

reviewText: In my opinion, this is the best DVD ever for a HIIT (high intensity interval training) workout!!  The power surges are at a perfect duration (2 minutes).  I definitely can feel my heart rate increase & decrease throughout the middle 2 miles.  I also love the fact that there are 3 workout options--when I'm pressed for time, I usually just do the 2 mile power walk.I wish Leslie would creat more DVDs like this.  I also have the Walk to the Hits: radio remixes DVD w/ HIIT sessions, and I think this 4 mile power walk is a way better option.

reviewText: Just rcvd the new 4 mile Power Walk Dvd today w/power surges. I did the 2 miles power walk after I did walk slim firm 4 fast miles. Love the new dvd!! Surges are Extremly powerful! Moves are all new! Mini jacks, twists, etc ADVISE: Sports bra is a MUST!! When doing the power surges you will be bouncing everywhere if u do not have a sports bra on! I did not have one on & I couldnt do every move completely bc I was flopping around if u know what I mean! I am a 34 C, pretty decent size, would also recommend form fitting yoga pants as well or your entire body will flop around during the surges, unless u have zero fat! Great new music! Only 27 mins for 2 miles, flew by! For advanced walkers only!
summary: New music, new moves, new Leslie! Fab!

reviewText: Leslie has come up with some great stepping routines. They provide an easy way to get your butt off the couch or away from the computer. Title: N/A

reviewText: Leslie's newest DVD has 4 fast miles and includes interval training.  The set is the newer studio that her other recent videos have been shot in -- it's nice and bright.  The format is 4 total miles -- 2 are classic walks and 2 include interval training, or "power surges" as Leslie calls them.  The 2 classic miles include some newer moves and are fast--the first mile comes in at just over 11 minutes including the warm up and the last mile is just over 12 minutes.  The middle two miles are both just over 13 minutes and include the intervals -- each of these miles has three sets of intervals, alternating 2 minutes of slower walking and 2 minute power surges, which have higher impact moves like jogging, mini jump rope moves, twists, and mini jacks.  Your heart rate stays up throughout so it feels like a good workout. On most of the miles, Leslie works with the younger group of women that have been in her recent videos.  She does one of the interval miles solo.  There are not too many opportunities to mix and match on this one  -- you can do all 4 miles or choose to do the 2 classic miles or the 2 miles with intervals.  Overall, a good aerobic workout with some new moves and new music!
summary: Leslie Freshens Up 4 Fast Miles With Intervals!

reviewText: **Pros**1. Leslie has really transformed her way of workout from the rest of the workouts she's mostly known to be like. There is A LOT and I mean A LOT of bouncing; getting on top of your toes and pushing yourself to keep up with her. She has these 'power surges' she'll make you do by the time you reach the 2nd mile. You'll do them three times in between slow movements to help you catch your breath. In the 3rd mile they are even worse. So the really the 1st and 4th mile are the easiest.I was wearing a pedometer and put it on low sensing just in case it read my body status dramatically. And even on low I burned VERY close to 500 calories by doing the entire 4 miles, which is 55 minutes. If it helps I am 159 pounds, 5'4, with a BMI of 27. I was still able to keep up with her despite me wanting to curse at my TV to give me a freaking break! Leslie has helped me lose 14 pounds so far. If you're going to do this DVD, make sure you've drunk plenty of water and MAKE SURE YOU HAVE THE ENERGY TO DO IT!If you are around 200 pounds, I'd probably suggest you start with something low impact. NOT THIS!!!**Cons**1. She does tend to change her step, which I have lost how many times I've had to readjust myself with hers. We all know she's known to say that it does not matter if it's left or right, but keeping up with her is the way I prefer to workout. She also does not give you time or warning for the next move. However, if you're a veteran walker, you should be EASILY able to follow quickly. So, it's really no biggie.2. The DVD does not directly take you to the menu. There's like 20 seconds at least of hindering with the warning message and other stuff.3. I was really disappointed in how much the DVD lacked other choices to choose from. I guess it was my mistake in not reading the reviews well enough. But at the menu screen there is- 4 Mile Power Walk- 2 Mile Classic Walk- 2 Mile Power ExpressAll are the same. The last two levels are basically just a breakdown of the first level. I was looking forward to doing the last two, which I assume would be different, but you'd basically be doing what you just did from the first option. I have been making DVD's for a few years, and they can hold at least 4 hours worth of stuff. So, I felt like I was kind of ripped off. You do the 4 miles and that's it; You've already explored all that the DVD could offer...so...now what? Make sure to watch some YouTube video reviews of her workouts, see if you'll think you will like it. There's a YouTube profile called Collage videos I believe that has many many many of her videos.**Neutral**1. All of her buddies are stickly women. But I feel like it had to be that way because this DVD is a POWER walk; meaning she may have needed slim women that can keep up with her. I know people seem to complain about that but it does not make a difference to me. but for whatever reason, the new faces just kind of seem...out of place. I'm not sure how to describe it. I could not really connect well with them. It was as if they did not want to be there.2. the music was somewhat okay. I recognized at least three songs from her DVD called 'Ultimate 5 Day Walk Plan'. There are also three women there from that same DVD, (Camilla, Carrie, & Heather).3.) The music kind of comes in and out of focus, but you can still hear it.In conclusion, I like the fact that it makes you push yourself, but this is the first DVD I'm disappointed in. but LESLIE I STILL LOVE YOU!!! However, I've found myself doing this DVD only for about a week straight from the very day I first received it. I LOVE that it gets me sweating, my heart POUNDING, and makes me feel like I'm really burning off fat.

reviewText: I own a lot of Leslie Sansone DVDs, and I've decided this one is the best. The difficulty of her DVDs can vary. Sometimes they're frustratingly easy (her earlier ones), but in the case of this one and a few others (the Belly Blast one is great too), she reaches the exact difficulty level I'm looking for--challenging, but not too much so.The first mile is easy, but that's because it's the warm up. After that, you hit the first 15-minute interval session. The moves seem really easy, but it gets your heart pumping. The same goes for the second 15-minute interval session. The last session is just a classic walking session, but there's still some bouncing and hopping around to keep your heart rate up. Then, like in all of her DVDs, she ends it with a stretch.Basically, I love it. For days when I feel like being really good, I go for the whole hour, but if I'm pressed for time I just mix and match three of the sessions for a 45-minute workout. YES, I see a lot of people complaining about the fact that you can't access the 4 sessions separately--your only options are the 2-mile classic walk and the 2-mile interval walks--but there's this wacky thing on your remote called the 'next' button. If, for instance, you only want to do the second interval session, you need only hit the 2-mile interval walk on the menu and then hit your remote's 'next' button. It will magically transport your DVD to the exact part you're looking for!Sorry for the sarcasm. Anyway, this workout is perfect in my opinion. It gets my heart pumping and time flies.

reviewText: This was my first Leslie dvd, and is what got me "sold" on her style.  I love her upbeat, sunny, positive attitude.  The walkers are very energetic and motivating as well.  This is my second copy of this workout, (THAT is how much I love it) as I gave away my first copy to a friend who was new to working out-- I knew she'd love it, and I was right- she's addicted to Leslie now, too!  I had to re-order this one, though, because it's one I definitely wanted to keep in my own rotation!This workout is a bit more advanced than some of her other workouts I own, but I love the 4 mile length and the fact that I get a great workout in, in under an hour.  The pace is fast and I love the power surges for calorie burn.  Very solid cardio workout that puts me in a great mood.  I love Leslie!

There is a lot of bouncing but one of the best exercises you can do for your whole body is jump roping. This way she gives us the motion without needing the rope coordination.  If you are a beginner I would pick a different DVD of hers to start with but if you want to add a little bounce to your walk this is wonderful.

reviewText: I bought the 30 day Walk Off pack and this dvd was included. I tried it today and I hate it. I clicked on the first menu option which was titled 4 mile Power Walk. What? There was nothing powerful about it. Leslie walks onto the set and immediately starts her Blah Blah Blah, nonstop yakking. She talks on about how important the warm up is. I like to get right to it.It starts with what seems like 5 minutes of just walking then 5 more minutes of side steps, all while she's running her mouth. I didn't feel like I got anything out of this segment and because of the title, I expected it to be 4 miles. Nope, its just one mile. When its over, it goes to the "power surge" section. I can't do much jumping, nor do I want to, because of my sensitive breasts and my bladder, so I didn't like this segment. I can't tell you much about the final segment because my dvd wouldn't go to it.Overall, I hate this dvd and I am already wishing I'd just bought a single dvd instead of this package but in the coming days, we'll see how much I like the other two included dvds.

reviewText: I am a big Leslie fan,and own about 15 of her videos. The four mile walk offers a decent workout, but it is actually 4 separate individual workouts strung together, rather than one 60 minute walk from beginning to end. I would have preferred the workout to be a single workout, particularly because of the way the music is organized. Some of the transitions between songs are awkward in the extreme, and Leslie runs out of song before she runs out of steps.  As far as the "power surges" go, the moves are the same or similar as those on the Blue mile of Lesie's "5 Day walk" video- half-jacks, weight shifts, jump rope- with some twists and fist pumping (yes, it's silly, but it's something new to do with your hands).  I quite liked them, because they're more like dancing. I am curious as to what happened to her old crew of walkers- Carol, Mary Kay, Joanne, and the others haven't appeared in her last 3 or so videos, so I don't know if they've been replaced or if they're just taking time off.  She brings back 3 of the young women from her earlier videos in this studio, and they're ok, but they appear to be in their 20s or early 30's, and don't appear to have ever had an ounce of fat on them in their lives (I would bet money that Camilla ran track in high school and college). Some of the other walkers appear to be close to Leslie's age, but they're all thin, rather than some thicker or heavier, as Leslie has had in most of her previous videos.  So, while I do like the video, there's plenty of room for improvement for the next one.

reviewText: This video is not one of Leslie's usual low impact workouts. The workout goes way beyond the light jogging or "boosted walking" that she includes in a few videos. This exercise routine includes hopping, jumping (half) jacks, and raise-those-knees-up jogging. Not surprisingly, all of the people who participate in the workout are young and fit. There is no range in fitness or age in this video.This is fine if you can handle it physically, but I am a long-time user of Leslie's workouts specifically because she provides a thorough workout that is low impact. If you have knee problems, or other reasons why you can't jump or full-out jog, I suggest you skip this one.
